item.title: Comment on What to think about ranked choice voting? by JSK
item.description:
‚ÄúIf the favorite candidate of one voter calls the favorite of another ‚Äúweird,‚Äù for example ‚Äî to choose an example not quite at random ‚Äî the latter voter might respond by voting down the name-caller to the very bottom.‚Äù

Lock her up, lock her up.

Little late for ‚Äúcivility in politics‚Äù.

That is all.

Reply to Hazel Meade:

Right. Many Bernie Sanders supporters have claimed, with some justification, that the Democratic primary in 2016 was rigged in favor of Hillary Clinton.

Were those Bernie supporters right?
